description: The British School at Athens. Supplementary Volumes Coverage: 1966-2007 (Nos. 3-41) Moving Wall: 3 years %IMAGEREPLACED% JSTOR Discipline(s): Archaeology, Classical Studies Published by: British School at Athens ISSN: 1464-0813 Journal Description The Supplementary Volumes, originally Papers, of the British School at Athens primarily consist of full publication of excavations carried out by members of the School or under its auspices, over the last one hundred and ten years.   Earlier volumes are devoted to a range of other topics, such as the techniques of Greek sculpture and the papers of George Finlay, an influential British figure in the early history of the modern Greek state.    The main body of the series covers excvations carried out at Lefkandi on the island of Euboia, in the Cyclades and on Crete, especially Knossos, during the whole of the sites lengthy history.   Places beyond modern Greece are also to be found, Smyrna in Turkey and Butrint in Albania.   All volumes are richly illustrated.
title: The British School at Athens. Supplementary Volumes
